Dear Ms. Jenovai:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
08/25/2021. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the MSA
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 An explanation why previous corrective action plans have not
obtained and maintained compliance for rules found in repeat
noncompliance
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license license will be
issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will
result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12212 Personnel records.
(3) The personnel record shall contain both of the following:
(a) A written evaluation of a staff member's performance
within a probationary period or not later than 6 months after the
staff member assumes his or her current responsibilities. After
the initial evaluation, a written evaluation shall be conducted
each year.
One of five new employee records reviewed showed the
employee’s 6 months performance evaluation due by 6/21/2021
was completed late on 7/2/2021.
R 400.12306 Application request.
(1) An agency shall provide an orientation for prospective
applicants for a foster home license before a foster home
application is provided.
One of four enrolled applicant records reviewed did not show
documentation of an orientation.
R 400.12306 Application request.
(3) An agency shall document that a person who has met the
requirements of subrule (1) of this rule has received an
application and information regarding all of the following:
(a) A copy of the act.
(c) Administrative rules for child placing agencies.
(d) Good moral character rules.
(e) The child protection law.
(f) The children’s ombudsman act.
(g) The agency's program statement.
Three of four enrolled applicant records reviewed did not show
documentation of(a), and (c)-(f) as required by the rule.
Two of four enrolled applicant records reviewed did not show
documentation of(g) as required by the rule.
4

R400.12311 Foster parent/agency agreement.
(2) The foster parent/agency agreement shall contain all of the
following provisions:
(e) The role of the lawyer guardian ad litem and the court.
Of the four open foster home records reviewed, the documented
foster parent/agency agreement did not contain the information
required by(e).
The agency reported the foster parent/agency agreement that
was on file is the current one. This current foster parent/
agreement does not meet the requirements of this rule.
R400.12324 Reevaluation.
(8) An agency shall complete a reevaluation and shall make a
licensing recommendation to the department at least 15
calendar days before the expiration date of the foster home
license.
One of four open foster home records reviewed showed the
licensing recommendation to the department occurred less the
15 days before the expiration date of the license. The foster
home licensing was expiring on 6/28/2021 and the
recommendation was submitted on 6/23/2021.
Repeat Violation – Renewal 2019.
R400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(c) A physical examination for each child as follows, unless a
greater frequency is medically indicated:
(ii) For a child 2 years of age or older, a physical
examination shall have been completed within 12 months before
placement or a new physical examination shall be completed
within 30 calendar days after placement.
One of eight open foster child records reviewed showed the
child’s medical examination due by 1/16/2021 was completed
18 days late on 2/3/2021.
R400.12418 Development of service plan.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
5

(a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the home.
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
(a):
Two of four initial service plans (ISP) reviewed were four and
five days late respectively.
Repeat Violation- Interim 2020; Renewal 2019.
(b):
One of 19 updated service plans (USP) was one day late.
R400.12420 Updated service plan.
(1) An updated service plan, as required in R400.12418(2)(b),
shall include all of the following information:
(e) A plan which includes any changes made since the previous
plan and which has the content specified in R400.12419.
In three of eight open child records reviewed the record did not
show documentation of compliance:
 One child’s last three USPs (10/24/2020-1/20/2021;
1/21/2021-4/7/2021 and 4/8/2021-7/2/2021, all reported
the same unchanged information under the Caregiver
input section.
 A second child’s ISP and next three USPs (9/2/2020-
11/23/2020; 11/24/2020-2/19/2021 and 2/20/2021-
5/19/2021) all reported the same, unchanged information
under the Caregiver input section.
 A third child’s last two USPs (1/16/2021-4/13/2021 and
4/14/2021-7/7/2021 all reported identical, unchanged
information under the Caregiver input section.
R400.12420 Updated service plan.
(1) An updated service plan, as required in R400.12418(2)(b),
shall include all of the following information:
(g) A child management plan which includes any changes made
since the previous plan and which is to be used by the foster
parents.
In one of eight open child records reviewed the record did not
show documentation of compliance:
 The child’s last three USPs did not indicate the specific
behavior management plan the foster parent was to use.
6

R 400.12502 Program statement.
(2) An agency shall give a copy of the program statement to a
youth before placement in independent living.
One of one independent living youth records reviewed did not
show documentation the youth was given a copy of the
agency’s program statement. .
R 400.12503 Policy and procedures.
(3) An agency shall provide a youth in independent living with a
copy of the agency's policies and procedures required by this
rule.
One of one independent living youth records reviewed did not
show documentation the youth was provided a copy of the
agency’s policies and procedures.
R 400.12509 Independent living record.
(3) The case record shall contain all of the following information
and documentation, which shall be recorded within 30 calendar
days after placement in independent living and updated at least
once every 90 calendar days:
(g) Current documentation of financial support sufficient to
meet the youth's housing, clothing, food, and miscellaneous
expenses.
One of one independent living youth records reviewed did not
show documentation of an updated budget/ financial support for
meeting the youth’s need after one dated 2/9/2021.
R400.12509 Independent living contract.
(1) There shall be mutually agreed upon contract between the
youth and the agency specifying all of the following:
(a) The responsibilities of the agency and youth.
(b) A plan for education or work.
(c) An agreement for the youth to meet with the worker at least
one time per calendar month.
(d)The location where the youth is living.
One of one independent living youth records reviewed did not
show documentation of a signed and dated initial mutually
agreed upon contract between the youth and agency as
required by the rule.
7

R 400.12510 Independent living contract.
(2) The agreement shall be signed and dated by the youth and
the social service worker. The contract shall be reviewed and
updated at least once every 90 calendar days and a copy
provided to the youth.
One of one independent living youth records reviewed did not
show documentation of updated signed and dated contracts due
by 3/16/2021 and 6/16/2021 (per the youth’s March 2021
service plan denotating an initial contract was signed
12/16/2020).
R400.12604 Orientation and application.
(1) An agency shall provide an orientation for prospective
applicants for adoption before an adoptive application is
provided.
(2) an agency shall, upon request, provide an adoptive
application to an interest family.
Three of three adoptive applicant records reviewed, where the
applicant sought to a adopt a child in foster care and where a
preliminary assessment was completed, did not show
documentation of an orientation or application.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance with all additional ISEP requirements except for the following:
ISEP 6.49 Medical passport
Two of eight open child records reviewed did not show
documentation of compliance:
 One child’s record did not show documentation of a
quarterly medical passport due in January 2021 and April
2021.
 A second child’s record did not show documentation of a
quarterly medical passport due in July 2021. Additionally,
this record did not show documentation that the child’s
medical passports reported for 1/19/2021 and 4/7/2021

3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
Policy FOM 722- Family team meeting.
6B
FTMs should include child welfare staff, parents, caretakers,
foster parents, children, youth, and may also include extended
family, friends, neighbors, community-based service providers,
community representatives, tribal representatives, for Indian
children, or other professionals involved with the family.
Each meeting must be documented in MiSACWIS using the
FTM hyperlink and all of the appropriate forms must be
completed for each type of meeting
Certain circumstances, events, and/or stages of case
progression mandate FTMs must occur within the required time
frames as out lined in the following tables.
Two of eight open child records reviewed did not show
documentation of compliance:
 One child’s record did not show an FTM for the child’s
5/20/2021-8/17/2021 service plans. An FTM was
completed after the service period on 8/19/2021.
 A second child’s record did not show an FTM for the
child’s 12/17/2020-1/15/2021 ISP. An FTM was
completed after the service period on 1/29/2021.
Policy FOM 722- Initial service plan approval.
8
Review and approve the ISP within 14 calendar days of the
report.
One of four initial service plans reviewed was approved seven

Repeat Violation-Renewal 2019
Policy FOM 722- Foster Care-Parent Agency Treatment Plan & Service
8C Agreement.
Signature: When completed, obtain all signatures as
appropriate, including those of parent(s)/guardian(s), foster care
worker, supervisor, foster parent, caregiver, any youth age 14

Of 19 service plans reviewed, four did not contain the foster

Repeat Violation- Renewal 2019.
Policy FOM 722- Foster care/Juvenile Justice Action Summary.
8E
The caseworker must complete the DHS-69, Foster
Care/Juvenile Justice Action Summary, and upload to
MISACWIS within the timeframe required for the specified
action/change:
Case Closure/ Change in placement:
Within three business days of foster care and/or juvenile justice
program/case closure or a placement change.
Two of three closed foster child records and one of one
independent living youth records reviewed did not show
compliance:
 One child’s record did not show documentation of a DHS-
69 for the child’s 2/23/2021 placement within the child’s
father’s home. The DHS-69 for the child’s return to the
department on 3/4/2021 was completed late on
3/10/2021.
 A second child’s record did not show documentation of a
DHS-69 for the child’s case closure. A DHS-69 for a
change in placement on 6/14/2021 was completed more
than three business days on 6/26/2021, and not
approved by the supervisor until 7/2/2021.
 The independent living youth record showed the DHS-69
for the youth’s change of placement on 1/11/2021 was
completed more than three business days on 1/21/2021.
Policy FOM 722- Updated service plan approval.
9
Review and approve the USP within 14 calendar days of the
report.
Five of 19 updated service plans reviewed were late:
 One child’s 1/26/2021-4/24/2021 USP completed
4/24/2021 was approved nine days late on 5/17/2021.
This child’s 4/25/2021-7/23/2021 USP completed
7/24/2021 was approved six days late on 8/13/2021.
10

 A second child’s 11/24/2020-2/19/2021 USP completed
2/19/2021 was approved 18 days late on 3/23/2021.
 A third child’s 1/16/2021-4/13/2021 USP completed
4/13/2021 was approved 10 days late on 5/7/2021. This
child’s 4/14/2021-7/7/2021 USP completed 7/7/2021 was
approved 22 days late on 8/12/2021
Policy ADM 300 Child Adoption Assessment.
The DHS-1927 Child adoption Assessment must be completed
by the adoption worker and approved by the adoption
supervisor within 45 calendar days of case acceptance.
One of six open child adoption records reviewed showed the
child’s adoption assessment due by 5/29/2021 was completed
late per the 7/23/2021 report date and 7/30/2021 supervisor’s
signature date.
Policy Adm 330 Quarterly Adoption Progress Report.
Quarterly adoption progress reports (DHHS-614) are to be
completed quarterly.
Two of six open child adoption records reviewed did not show
documentation of compliance:
 One record showed the child’s quarterly progress report
due by 3/24/2021 and 6/23/2021 were completed more
than five and two months late respectively on 8/30/2021.
 A second child’s record showed the child’s 12/2/2020
quarterly progress report was completed seven days late
on 12/9/2020. This child’s next quarterly progress report
due by 3/2/2021 was completed 15 days late on
3/17/2021
Policy SRM 200 Fingerprints.
All personnel, contractors, vendors, and external auditors who
have access to CW-CHRI are required to complete Security
Awareness Training (SAT).
SAT is required to be taken within six months of working in a
position with CW-CHRI access and every 2 years thereafter.
CAPAs are responsible for ensuring all personnel with CW-
CHRI access complete SAT timely. SAT certificates must be
maintained in all employee personnel files and/or their LMS
transcripts to confirm completion of training.
11

In six of 16 employee records where the employee had CHRI
access the agency’s documentation did not show compliance:
 Two employees’ initial SAT training was due by
12/12/2020 and 2/28/2021 respectively and the training
was overdue at the time of this Renewal inspection.
 Four other employee’s updated SAT training, three due in
February 2021 and one in July 2021 were all overdue at
the time of this Renewal inspection.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
R400.12212(2)(d) Personnel records
 The agency was apprised references shall consistently be dated.
R400.12418(6) Development of service plan.
 The agency was apprised the service plan shall consistently be signed by
both worker and supervisor.
ISEP 4.22 MISACWIS Documentation
 The agency is apprised it shall ensure all required service documents are
consistently uploaded to MISACWIS.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
ISEP 6.33 service plan signed by birth parents
 The agency was advised placing the date it mailed the parent agency
treatment plan agreement to the parent, onto the said document may it in
showing compliance.
12

EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
AND
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. The corrective action plan related to the
agency’s 2020 Interim inspection, where it received the following rule violations:
 R400.12324(8) for Reevaluation,
 R400.12326(1)(e) for Borrowed home.
 R400.12413(1)(d) for Medical and dental care policy.
 R400.12418(2)(a) for Development of service plans.
 R400.12418(6) for Development of service plans.
The agency made significant progress with that corrective action, but was not totally
success, in that it received a repeat violation for R400.12324(8) and
400.12418(2)(a).
CWL ANALYST ISSUES ADDRESSED:
There were no safety alerts indicated this inspection.
VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
